slides.title: Template Language Basics
slides.content:
# Django Template Language üìù Django templates are just HTML files with special syntax to inject logic and data. ## Variables `{{ }}` Output a value from the context. ```html

Hello, {{ user.username }}!

Score: {{ user.profile.score }}

``` ## Tags `{% %}` Control logic (loops, conditions). ```html {% if user.is_authenticated %}

Welcome back!

{% else %} Log in {% endif %} ``` ## Filters `|` Modify variables for display. ```html {{ name|upper }} {{ date|date:"Y-m-d" }} ```

slides.title: Common Tags
slides.content:
# Essential Tags üè∑Ô∏è ## For Loop Iterate over lists or querysets. ```html
    {% for item in items %}
  • {{ item.name }} - ${{ item.price }}
    • {% empty %}
  • No items found.
    • {% endfor %}
``` > üí° **Tip**: The `{% empty %}` block runs if the list is empty! ## URL Tag Generate links dynamically. ```html Link ``` ## CSRF Token Required for security in forms. ```html
{% csrf_token %} ...
```

slides.title: Template Inheritance
slides.content:
# Template Inheritance üß¨ The most powerful feature of DTL! It allows you to build a base "skeleton" template containing common elements (nav, footer) and define **blocks** that child templates can override. **base.html**: ```html
...
{% block content %}{% endblock %}
...
``` **home.html**: ```html {% extends "base.html" %} {% block content %}

Home Page

This replaces the block in base!

{% endblock %} ```

slides.title: Handling Static Files
slides.content: # Static Files üñºÔ∏è Static files are images, CSS, and JavaScript that don't change dynamically. ## Setup 1. Make sure `django.contrib.staticfiles` is in `INSTALLED_APPS`. 2. Define `STATIC_URL = '/static/'` in `settings.py`. ## Usage in Templates Always load the `static` tag library first. ```html {% load static %} ```
